allergies:
Penicillin – causes rash and facial swelling
Pollen – causes seasonal sneezing and itchy eyes
diagnoses:
Type 2 diabetes (diagnosed 2015)
High blood pressure
High cholesterol
medications:
Metformin 500 mg – twice daily with food
Amlodipine 5 mg – once daily in the morning
Atorvastatin 20 mg – once daily at night
notes:
Non-smoker, drinks alcohol occasionally.
Walks 20–30 minutes on most days.
Blood pressure is usually well-controlled on current treatment.
No history of heart attack or stroke.
Checks blood sugar at home a few times per week and brings readings to GP appointments.
